  • About me

Senzo Studio is a VFX agency that works for globally recognized production companies.

Project goal

The project consists of designing a website that allows Senzo Studio to gain visibility on the internet and strengthen their brand image.

Rol

Product designer

Date

March, 2021

Category

Web design

Timeline

4 weeks

Research

User interviews & Job to be done

For the analysis, I interviewed a VFX student and a film producer, a potential client of Senzo Studio. The goal is to extract the information that both profiles need in order to build the website, including this content.

Mario González

Age: 21

Occupation: VFX student

Location: Madrid

What is your purpose?

"I am looking to learn about animation techniques and tools used in the industry to improve my skills and stay on top of market trends. I'm also interested in being able to get my first job as a VFX artist to improve my skills and launch my career".

Job to be done

When I just finished graduating as a VFX Artist I want to find a job opportunity So I can that will allow me to get my first job and not delay my career as a VFX specialist

Brian Johnson

Age: 48

Occupation: True Lights CEO

Location: London

What is your purpose?

"I need to speed up my production and post-production process so that I can meet the project's deadlines and the film can be released on the agreed-upon date".

Job to be done

When I just signed a new contract with a production company I want to speed up the post-production process So I can devliver the project on time

Mario González

User-story Map

With a clear understanding of the jobs to be done, the user map is established.

User-story map: web site feature to provide employment opportunities

User-story map: web site feature to show work and experience

Analysis of the competitors

We identify who the main competitors are and establish the lines of study..

Purpose

One of the critical steps when developing a new product is finding out where you stand with the competition. Competitive analysis is a necessary part of the design process to help businesses gain valuable insight into the market, identify their products’ strengths and weaknesses, and develop effective product strategies to create winning results.

What we did

We examined and collected data, from 18 different direct and indirect competitors (some provide by the company and some chosen by the design team).

What was evaluated

  • General UX
    • Customer journeys
    • User flows
    • Ease of use
    • Strenghts
    • Architecture and hierarchy
      • Prominent Call to Action per page and section
      • Ease of navigation
      • Layout
      • Information presented at each point
      • Division of content per customer segments
  • Branding
    • General look and feel
    • Tone of voice and language
    • Industry slangs and language used per customer segment
  • Customer segment
    • Employer
    • Job seeker - Multiple circunstances
    • Aprenctice
  • Activities beyond website
    • Socal media presence
    • Customer service and interaction
    • Branding

Competitors

Validation

Card sorting
